results.title: Bad girls. Series one. Discs 3 & 4
results.creator_credit: Brian Park and Shed Productions (Jailbirds) Ltd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Bad girls. Series one”.
Playing with fire (wri. Ann McManus, dir. Jim O’Hanlon): Zandra’s under pressure from Shell to find her stash of smuggled drugs and is quick to drop in Warden Rose. Nikki moves in next door to Shell and Lorna’s career is in jeopardy. Shell has her privileges stripped. “Falling apart” (wri. Sally Wainwright, dir. Mike Adams): Shell uses her powers of sexual persuasion to get back into the threes. The Louises get into wine making and Monica receives devastating news. “Pay back time” (wri. Martin Allen, dir. Mike Adams): Lorna returns from holidays, Monica’s still not speaking and Shell claims she’s come off drugs and found religion. She also vows to settle a score with Lorna. Helen struggles to resist Nikki’s charms. “Love hurts” (wri. Maureen Chadwick, dir. Mike Adams): Monica’s appeal nears. New prisoner Yvonne Atkins (Linda Henry) is making a good impression on the women and is full of lots of inventive ideas for improvement. There’s tension between Helen and Nikki and Helen’s having second thoughts about her impending marriage.

results.title: The Ohio River
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Background for Social Studies”.
Colonists floating down the Ohio River helped to settle the present cities of Pittsburgh, Cincinatti, Louisville, Huntington and Wheeling. Today the Ohio is America’s busiest inland waterway. Its enormous volume of water and nearby coalfields have attracted steel, chemical, aluminium and atomic energy plants, and efforts are being made to solve problems of water pollution, flood control and increasing traffic.

group_works.title: Zoo animals of our story books

results.title: Zoo animals of our story books
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Background for Social Studies”.
Designed to stimulate young children’s interest in reading stories about animals that can be seen in a zoo. These animals are compared with the character found in storybooks, such as tigers in “Little Black Sambo”, deer in “Bambi” and bears in “Goldilocks and the Three Bears”. The film concludes with an invitation to the children to make up their own story based on the character “Bubble the Elephant”.

results.title: John Blight
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: writers I”.
An insightful and humorous conversation with the renowned Queensland poet brimming with anecdotes about the Depression and the development of his poetry.

results.title: A.D. Hope
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: writers I”.
A D Hope talks in this entertaining interview of his childhood and its influence on his poetry, and the conflict with his life as a critic and academic.

results.title: Alan Marshall
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: writers I”.
A memorable discussion with an author of extraordinary spirit and charm, who is internationally known for his novel “I Can Jump Puddles”.

results.title: Christina Stead
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: writers I”.
In the only filmed interview with one of Australia’s most popular and respected novelists, Christina Stead is both challenging and revealing.

results.title: Hal Porter
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: writers I”.
A witty, biting commentary about life and an author’s place in it. Hal Porter reminisces about teaching, acting, producing for the theatre, and his life in Melbourne, Bairnsdale and Japan.
